td.content: s:white male aged 74 ys presents with intrusive thoughts x 7 weeks. patient also reports vivid flashbacks, self destructive urges. pt experienced trauma: car accident approx. 35 years ago. he reports having no more than one drink a day denies any smoking o:avoidance of thoughts associated with events, 2/3 recall at 3 times, oriented x 2, Patient looked tired, appears very agitated, hypervigilance throughout the exam, Affect was congruent. BDI 25, CAPS B=3,C=4,D=3. a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed BDI, CAPS, and performed socialization to treatment - Explained that symptoms were common for someone having experienced such trauma; socialization to treatment - Discussed Safety Plan; counseling about life problems - Discussed other life issues - learned that Patient had concern about their partner drug abuse; counseling about life problems - Suggested various social services available for helping to deal with their partner drug abuse; counseling about life problems - Discussed with patient their social support network; Psychiatric diagnostic evaluation - Completed, and ordered homework (fill out standard intake forms), homework (read handouts about PTSD therapy).

td.content: s:74 year old white m retired c/o 8 days h/o vivid flashbacks, self destructive urges and intrusive thoughts. Initial trauma: car accident. o:avoidance of thoughts associated with events, 2/3 recall at 3 times, oriented x 2, Patient looked tired, appears very agitated, hypervigilance throughout the exam, Affect was congruent. Review of intake forms done, BDI 25, Suicide assessment moderate. a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed Review of intake forms, BDI, Suicide assessment, and performed socialization to treatment - Discussed homework - helped patient start to fill in goal worksheet; counseling about life problems - Discussed social services to help with their partner drug abuse; social service referral - Patient agreed they wanted to try Nar-Anon; socialization to treatment - Discussed Cognitive-behavioral model of PTSD and that such treatments were mostly contraindicated until patient has stabilized and reduced level of anxiety; socialization to treatment - Discussed value of anxiety management exercises; anxiety management skills - Asked patient to list activities that were found to be relaxing; anxiety management skills - Asked patient to choose a previously close confidant to reengage with; Psychotherapy, 60 minutes - Completed, and ordered homework (finish writing goals for therapy), homework (set up appointment with social service), homework (participate in some of the activities identified as relaxing), homework (attempt to contact previously supportive person and talk with them).

Value.Value: Review of intake forms , BDI , Suicide

content2.Value: Review of intake forms , BDI , Suicide

td.content: s:74 year old white male presents with 9 months history of vivid flashbacks. patient also reports increased frequency of intrusive thoughts, self destructive urges. States that he experienced car accident. o:avoidance of thoughts associated with events, 2/3 recall at 3 times, oriented x 2, Patient looked tired, appears very agitated, hypervigilance throughout the exam, Affect was congruent. Review of patient goals done. a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed Review of patient goals, and performed socialization to treatment - Reviewed Safety Plan in light of homework; counseling about life problems - Discussed patient interaction with Nar-Anon; social service referral - Patient agreed to continue working with Nar-Anon; socialization to treatment - Reviewed relaxation activities since last appointment; socialization to treatment - Reviewed attempt to reengage with former socially supportive person; anxiety management skills - Sleep disruption exercises: discussed sleep hygiene and deep breathing for reengaging with sleep; Psychotherapy, 60 minutes - Completed, and ordered homework (practice anxiety management skills), homework (Continue to participate in activities listed as relaxing), homework (Attempt to have second positive interaction with reengaged support person).

td.content: s:white male retired aged 74 yrs presents with 11 days history of self destructive urges. patient also reports vivid flashbacks, intrusive thoughts. Exposed to car accident approx. 35 years ago. o:avoidance of thoughts associated with events, 2/3 recall at 3 times, oriented x 2, Patient looked tired, appears very agitated, hypervigilance throughout the exam, Affect was congruent. a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed social service referral - Review patient interaction with Nar-Anon; social service referral - Received permission from patient to call patient's Nar-Anon counselor; anxiety management skills - Breathing relaxation skill taught; anxiety management skills - Thought stopping skill taught; socialization to treatment - Reviewed relaxation activities since last appointment; socialization to treatment - Reviewed attempt to reengage with former socially supportive person; anxiety management skills - Sleep disruption exercises: discussed sleep hygiene and deep breathing for reengaging with sleep; Psychotherapy, 60 minutes - Completed, and ordered homework (practice anxiety management skills), homework (Continue to participate in activities listed as relaxing).

td.content: s:74 yr old male retired presents w/ c/o 7 weeks h/o intrusive thoughts, frequent vivid nightmares and difficulty participating in activities stemming from exposure to car accident (10/10/1979). o:appropriate behavior with no abnormal movement, good eye contact, appears agitated, denies suicidal/homicidal ideation intent or plan, normal speech but slow rate, oriented x 3, poor concentration, affect is appropriate with normal range. Suicide assessment moderate. a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed Suicide assessment, and performed anxiety management skills - Breathing relaxation and progressive muscle relaxation skills practiced; anxiety management skills - Thought stopping skill practiced; cognitive-behavioral interventions - Socratic dialog used to help patient understand that choices made at time of the traumatic incident were rational at the time; Psychotherapy, 60 minutes - Completed, and ordered homework (practice anxiety management skills).

td.content: s:74 yr old male retired with nightmares, difficulty concentrating and trouble sleeping. he has had several such episodes over past 2 years. patient experienced trauma: car accident approx. 35 years ago. o:good concentration, mood is euthymic, affect is appropriate with normal range, alert and oriented x 3, normal speech with normal rhythm, Heart = normal S1, S2, RRR. BDI 13. a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed BDI, and performed socialization to treatment - Discuss with patient the good progress that they are making in therapy: better able to face the trauma, better able to handle their partner drug abuse, better able to interact with others; assessment of treatment progress - Patient agrees that they also see the progress; assessment of treatment progress - Patient agrees to delay follow-up date to 1 month out; cognitive-behavioral interventions - Discuss with patient their changes in interaction with others since therapy had begun; Psychotherapy, 45 minutes - Completed.

td.content: s:M retired aged 74 years presents with nightmares for 12 days. he also reports trouble sleeping, difficulty concentrating stemming from exposure to car accident (10/10/1979). o:good concentration, mood is euthymic, affect is appropriate with normal range, alert and oriented x 3, normal speech with normal rhythm, Heart = normal S1, S2, RRR. a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed socialization to treatment - Review Safety Plan; cognitive-behavioral interventions - Teach techniques for overcoming patient overgeneralizations; assessment of treatment progress - Discuss end-of-treatment scenarios; assessment of treatment progress - Patient suggests that there be one more session and then we try holding off on additional sessions; Psychotherapy, 45 minutes - Completed, and ordered homework (practice new cognitive modification techniques).

td.content: s:white male aged 74 yrs presents for PTSD evaluation. o:patient responding well to treatment a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed assessment of treatment progress - Agree to not schedule a followup unless/until patient needs one; counseling about life problems - Discuss with patient the importance of continuing to work with Nar-Anon for addressing issues stemming from their partner drug abuse; cognitive-behavioral interventions - Review techniques that worked best for patient over course of treatment; cognitive-behavioral interventions - Review various approaches patient can use when crises arise; Psychotherapy, 45 minutes - Completed.
